name: Zakir Hossain

recipes.name: Chicken Biryani
recipes.cookingMethod: Soak 2 cups of basmati rice for 30 minutes, then drain and set aside. Fry 1 large sliced onion until golden brown, remove from the pot and set aside. Stir-fry 1 pound of cubed chicken breast with 1 tablespoon of ginger garlic paste, 2 tablespoons of biryani masala, and salt to taste. Add the soaked rice to the pot, stir to coat with the chicken and spices, and add enough water to cover it completely.
ingredients: 1 pound of boneless, skinless chicken breast, cubed

recipes.name: Beef Curry
recipes.cookingMethod: Heat 2 tablespoons of vegetable oil in a large pot or Dutch oven over medium-high heat. Add the chopped onion and sauté until soft and translucent. Add the minced garlic and grated ginger and cook for 1-2 minutes, stirring constantly.Add 2 tablespoons of curry powder, 1 teaspoon of ground cumin, 1 teaspoon of ground coriander, 1/2 teaspoon of turmeric, and 1/2 teaspoon of red chili powder (optional). Stir well and cook for 1-2 minutes until fragrant.
ingredients: 1 pound beef stew meat, cut into bite-sized pieces

recipes.name: Butter Chicken
recipes.cookingMethod: In a large bowl, mix together 1/2 cup of plain yogurt, 2 tablespoons of lemon juice, 1 tablespoon of grated ginger, 3 cloves of minced garlic, 1/2 teaspoon of turmeric, 1/2 teaspoon of ground cumin, 1/2 teaspoon of paprika, 1/2 teaspoon of red chili powder (optional), and salt and black pepper to taste.Add the chicken pieces to the marinade and toss to coat. Cover and refrigerate for at least 30 minutes or up to 2 hours.Heat 1/4 cup of unsalted butter in a large skillet over medium heat. Add the chopped onion and sauté until soft and translucent.
ingredients: 1 pound boneless chicken thighs or breasts, cut into bite-sized pieces

bio: Zakir Hossain is a Bangladeshi chef known for his authentic and flavorful Bangladeshi dishes.

bio: Tommy Miah is a Bangladeshi chef based in the UK, who is credited with popularizing Bangladeshi cuisine in Britain.
